text: Graham Paul Webb (13 January 1944 - 28 May 2017) was an English racing cyclist. He became the world amateur road race champion in 1967. In response to a journalist's shouted comment that the last British amateur world road champion had been Dave Marsh 45 years earlier, Webb retorted: "And they'll have to wait another 45 years before another British rider wins."Interview, Procycling March 2007 Webb died on 28 May 2017 in London at the age of 73.Obituary: Former world champion Graham Webb â€” 1944-2017 ==References== ==Other websites== Category:1944 births Category:2017 deaths Category:British cyclists Category:Disease-related deaths in London Category:Sportspeople from Manchester
title: Graham Webb
